OutlineScope: Benefits realisation audit following implementation of new meat charging discount system. Audit will review how well original objectives have been met
To review implementation and application of policy and procedures on open data specifically in relation to publication of data sets

Evolve programme will replace the current IT contract with a different model. This change involves gradual disaggregation of services and increasing the number of suppliers to be managed by the FSA as well as the FSA assuming responsibility for elements of the contract that are currently managed by Capita. The audit will review the efficacy of the plans in place to manage the risk of disruption arising from the transition to the new model.
The audit will review implementation of agreed actions

Performance management is a key area for the Agency with work continuing to develop KPIs to improve Vfm. The audit will assesses objective setting and KPIs at Directorate and cascading these to individual team level and the subsequent monitoring and reporting of performance. Audit will also be used to validate the controls management assurance framework self-assessment score for  Business Planning and Performance Management

AuditTitle: Management of Contract for supply of OVs and MHIs
OutlineScope: The audit will review effectiveness of contract management  arrangements
The audit will review budgets available at corporate, directorate and team level to ensure these are aligned with FSA priorities
The audit will review transfer of programme outcomes to business as usual
The audit will review risk identification, assessment and mitigation plans.
The audit will examine work of the Investment  Board in prioritising resource allocation
The audit will review effectiveness of business as usual controls that the FSA is responsible for following implementation of the programme.
The audit will assess effectiveness of FSA controls for RDM on farms where the FSA is directly responsible.
Original audit in 2016/17 resulted in ?Limited? assurance opinion. Audit will assess effectiveness of management actions taken to address issues identified in the report.
The audit will review effectiveness of official controls and follow?up on policy related issues highlighted in previous audit report
The audit will review effectiveness of the recently introduced system in approved slaughter houses.
FSA currently reviewing efficacy of product recall system with a view to developing and implementing an improved model. The audit will review effectiveness of the new product recall model.
